OECD AI Capability Indicators

This document introduces the OECD AI Capability Indicators, a framework designed to assess and compare nations' capabilities in artificial intelligence. It’s published under the responsibility of the OECD Secretary-General and represents the views of member countries, not necessarily official stances. The document emphasizes neutrality regarding territorial disputes, explicitly stating that data and maps are presented without prejudice to the status of territories like the Golan Heights, East Jerusalem, and Israeli settlements in the West Bank, adhering to international law. A significant portion of the document addresses the complex ‘Cyprus issue,’ acknowledging the division of the island and the recognition of the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus (TRNC) by Türkiye. The note from the European Union Member States clarifies that the Republic of Cyprus is recognized by all members of the EU. The document highlights the ongoing political complexities surrounding Cyprus and the need for a lasting solution within the framework of the United Nations. The inclusion of these sensitive geopolitical considerations underscores the OECD's commitment to presenting data and analysis in a balanced and objective manner, while acknowledging the inherent challenges in assessing AI capabilities within a context of ongoing international disputes. The document’s careful wording reflects the need to navigate delicate political landscapes and maintain neutrality regarding contentious territorial claims. The focus on the ‘Cyprus issue’ demonstrates the importance of considering geopolitical factors when evaluating AI development and adoption across different nations. The overall purpose of the indicators is to provide a standardized approach to measuring AI capabilities, but the document’s careful framing acknowledges the significant influence of political and territorial disputes on this assessment.

OECD AI Capability Indicators Cyprus Türkiye UN Golan Heights East Jerusalem Israeli settlements West Bank TRNC
